properties.areaDesc: Wayne, WV; Cabell, WV; Lawrence, OH; Boyd, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 14 at 8:07AM EST until February 16 at 2:31AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Kentucky...West Virginia...

Ohio River At Huntington affecting Wayne, Cabell, Boyd and
Lawrence Counties.

For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River At Huntington.
* Until late Saturday night.
* At 7:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 50.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 50.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending
at 7:00 AM EST Friday was 50.2 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 50.5 feet
just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage
tomorrow evening.
* Impact...At 50.0 feet, West Virginia Route 2 at Glenwood is
flooded. Many low-lying sections near the river are flooded due to
backwater.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.4
feet on 07/31/1994.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM EST.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning is now in effect until early Sunday morning
